input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
Sets the runaway recall limit to the specified number.
Schedules jobs using the following inputs: Valid values: login, idle, startup
Schedule time is only specified if a schedule start is not specified. time is in the 24 hour format
Specifies time period. Valid values: day, week, month
Occurence value input is valid only if "week" or "month" have been specified in "occurence option": It indicates in the case of "week"
Time is always specified in 24 hour
Specifies the number of media copies.
Specifies how many migrate jobs/recalls can be executed concurrently.
Specifies whether administrators are exempt from the runaway recall limit. 0 indicates that they are not; 1 indicates that they are. Valid values: 0, 1

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Linux.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on SunOS.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">rss admin set </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${recall limit}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/recalllimit:${recall limit} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${media copies}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/mediacopies:${media copies} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${schedule start}') !=0 and '${schedule start}' ='login'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">at ${schedule start} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${schedule start}') !=0 and '${schedule start}' ='idle'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">at ${schedule start} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${schedule start}') !=0 and '${schedule start}' ='startup'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">at ${schedule start} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${schedule start}') =0 and string-length('${schedule time}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">at ${schedule time} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${schedule occurence}') !=0 and '${occurence option}' ='day'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">every ${schedule occurence} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${schedule occurence}') !=0 and '${occurence option}' ='week'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">every ${schedule occurence} week ${occurence value} $[occurence time] </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${schedule occurence}') !=0 and '${occurence option}' ='month'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">every ${schedule occurence} month ${occurence value} $[occurence time] </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${concurrency}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/concurrency:${concurrency} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${admin exempt}') !=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/adminexempt:${admin exempt} </xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Windows XP"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Windows XP.</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Update RSS Storage Update Remote Storage parameters.
